meanings.definition: A slender, tactile, whisker-like organ near the mouth of certain fish.
meanings.sent1: The catfish uses its barbels to sense food in the murky water.
meanings.sent2: The angler carefully observed the barbels of the carp as it swam by.
meanings.sent3: The barbels of the fish were so sensitive, they could detect the tiniest movement in the water.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was like the barbels of a fish, picking up on subtle cues others missed.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman admired the barbels of the catfish, marveling at their delicate nature.

meanings.definition: A fleshy filament or process on the jaws of some insects.
meanings.sent1: The butterfly's barbels helped it taste the nectar of the flowers.
meanings.sent2: The entomologist studied the barbels of the beetle under a magnifying glass.
meanings.sent3: The barbels of the insect wiggled as it tried to nibble on the leaf.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was like the barbels of an insect, always exploring new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The dragonfly's barbels shimmered in the sunlight, adding to its beauty.
